{{also|Nein}} ==German== ===Alternative forms=== * {{l|de|ne}}, {{l|de|nee}}, {{l|de|nö}}, {{l|de|nä}}, {{l|de|na}} {{qualifier|colloquial, regional}} ===Etymology=== From a contraction of {{der|de|goh|ni}} {{m|goh|ein}}. Compare {{cog|ang|nān}}, from {{m|ang|ne}} {{m|ang|ān}} (Modern {{cog|en|none}}, further contracted to {{m|en|no}}). ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/naɪ̯n/}} * {{audio|de|CPIDL German - Nein.ogg|Audio}} * {{audio|de|De-at-nein.ogg|Audio (Austria)}} * {{audio|de|De-nein.ogg|Audio}} * {{rhymes|de|aɪ̯n}} ===Interjection=== {{de-interjection}} # [[no]] #: {{ux|de|Hast du morgen Abend Zeit? — '''Nein''', leider nicht.|“Do you have time tomorrow night?” — “'''No''', unfortunately not.”}} ====Usage notes==== * '''''Nein''''', being the standard word, is acceptable in all contexts. Colloquial German has a strong tendency to prefer the alternative forms given above, however. ====Antonyms==== * {{l|de|ja}} * {{l|de|doch}} ====Derived terms==== {{der-top}} * {{l|de|jein}} * {{l|de|Nein|g=n}} {{der-mid}} * {{l|de|nein doch}}! - certainly not! * {{l|de|nein und abermals nein}}! - no and again no! {{der-bottom}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} [[Category:German phrasebook]] ---- ==Hunsrik== {{cardinalbox|hrx|8|9|10|acht|zehn|ord=neint}} ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|hrx|/naɪ̯n/}} ===Numeral=== {{head|hrx|numeral}} # {{cln|hrx|cardinal numbers}} [[nine]] #: {{ux|hrx|Is-es schun '''nein''' Uher?|Is it '''nine''' o'clock already?}} ===Further reading=== * [https://hunsriqueanoriograndense.wordpress.com/dicionario-werterbuch/ Online Hunsrik Dictionary] ---- ==Pennsylvania German== {{cardinalbox|pdc|8|9|10|acht|zehe|ord=neint}} ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|pdc|/naɪ̯n/}} ===Etymology=== Compare {{cog|de|neun}}, {{cog|nl|negen}}, {{cog|en|nine}}. ===Numeral=== {{head|pdc|numeral}} # {{cln|pdc|cardinal numbers}} [[nine]]
